cause.description:
Supporting an organization in Israel - Mifal Chaim/Meir Panim, a network of thirty relief centers including: 1)15 soup kitchen-restaurants feeding 8,800 needy diners daily, in a dignified environment complete with uniformed volunteer waiters and four course meals. Diners also have the options of having their meals packed to go, to eat their meals privately at home. 2)15 Power of Giving warehouse distribution centers supplying used furniture,appliances, clothing and toys to more than 26,000 impoverished families and 200 lone soldiers. 3) Meals for Children lunch program feeding over 10,000 needy children in schools. 4) Power of Enterprise-Vocational Training to help the needy return to the work-force, 5) Occupational Rehabilitation Project- providing the mentally disabled with compensated employment 6) Battered Women Project-employment training to ease transition from shelters to independency 7 ) 8 After School Youth Clubs-providing hot meals, tutoring and a supportive environment for children at risk, also including parenting schools 8) A Full Plate Project-10,000 pre-paid food cards with a credit line of $54 per month provided to low income families.
1. Hunger cuts across all of Israel's political, religious and social boundaries.
2. It is not enough to feed the hungry, it is necessary to do so with respect.
3. In addition to providing immediate relief, it is important to help those in need get back on their feet.
cause.name: American Friends of Meir Panim
